TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit SubscribeType extends ExchangeWebServices.BaseRequestType

Docs.summary: The class represents a request to subscribe to notifications of events on mailboxes in the Exchange database.

remarks.para: The class is used for both push and pull notification types.

example.para: The following code example shows you how to create a pull notification subscription that monitors the Inbox and another folder. The

Inbox is identified by the class and the other folder is identified by the class. Both folders are monitored for new e-mail messages, copied items, moved items, modified items, created items, and deleted items. The subscription will time out only if a GetEvents call is not made within the time-out interval.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ Item { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the subscription type. This property gets or sets either a or object. This property is required. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a object that represents the subscription type.

remarks.para: The property can be set with either a or object. Both types extend , which is an abstract class. For more information about why this property is set with these objects, see XML Schema Choice Element Proxy Artifacts.
